channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Brisbane Pride Festival
item.description:
Sunday, September 24, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to celebrate Brisbane Pride Festival.

The Brisbane Pride Festival serves as a major fundraiser for Brisbane Pride, raising vital funds to improve the sense of community, mental health and the well-being of the LGBTIQ+ communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Pride Festival Inc

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
item.xCal:description:
Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to celebrate Brisbane Pride Festival.
The Brisbane Pride Festival serves as a major fundraiser for Brisbane Pride, raising vital funds to improve the sense of community, mental health and the well-being of the LGBTIQ+ communities.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Pride Festival Inc
item.x-trumba:customfield: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, September 24, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support Prostate Cancer Awareness Month.

Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia is the country's leading community-based organisation for prostate cancer research, awareness, and support. We exist to protect the health of existing and future generations of men in Australia and to improve quality of life for men and families impacted by prostate cancer. Our vision is a future where no man dies of prostate cancer and Australian men and their families get the support they need.
September marks Prostate Cancer Awareness Month and The Long Run campaign. The campaign challenges people to run 72km throughout the month of September to raise vital funds and awareness for PCFA's prostate cancer research and support services. Prostate cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia, with 1 in 5 men diagnosed before the age of 85. That's over 24,000 each year. Raising awareness of prostate cancer and inspiring locals to fundraise will help save lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia Limited

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: 2023 Global ITP Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, September 25, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support 2023 Global ITP Awareness Week.

ITP Australia was founded 5 years ago by our CEO Danielle Boyle, to help provide people living with this rare condition with up-to-date Australian information, support, and advocacy on their behalf. Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP) is a rare autoimmune disease where the body’s immune system attacks platelets. Platelets assist the blood to clot and patients with ITP have a low platelet count. Patients with ITP can suffer from a vast range of symptoms and there is no cure.

This Light Up is organised by: ITP Australia Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support 2023 Global ITP Awareness Week.

Patients with ITP can suffer from a vast range of symptoms and there is no cure.
This Light Up is organised by: ITP Australia Ltd

item.title: 2023 Global ITP Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, September 25, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple to support 2023 Global ITP Awareness Week.

The annual ITP Awareness Week campaign raises awareness for those living with the rare disease ITP. As with many rare diseases, many ITP patients never get the chance to meet another patient in person, so by lighting up various structures purple across the country, we provide local patients with the knowledge that they aren’t in this alone. ITP is a rare autoimmune blood disorder where the body’s immune system attacks platelets. Platelets assist the blood to clot and patients with ITP have a low platelet count. Patients with ITP can suffer from a vast range of symptoms including spontaneous bleeding, bruising, fatigue, anxiety and mood changes.

This Light Up is organised by: ITP Australia Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Purple to support 2023 Global ITP Awareness Week.

item.title: Celebration of Mates in Construction
item.description:
Tuesday, September 26, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and White as a Celebration of Mates in Construction.

MATES in Construction is a community development charity that works in the construction and building sector to help improve mental health and reduce suicide rates. Tonight we celebrate members and volunteers of the construction industry working hard to make it a safer place to be by having life saving conversations everyday. MATES Stronger Together.

This Light Up is organised by: MATES in Construction

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and White as a Celebration of Mates in Construction.

item.title: 81st World Congress of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
item.description:
Wednesday, September 27, 2023

City Hall will be light Blue to celebrate the Closing Gala Dinner of the 81st World Congress of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences.

This light up has been organised by the International Pharmaceutical Federation



Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Childhood Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, September 27, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Gold to support Childhood Cancer Awareness Month.

Built on Love and Hope, we are dedicated to raising funds and awareness to help all childhood cancer families.

This Light Up is organised by: Golden Octopus Foundation

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, September 28, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue to support Prostate Cancer Awareness Month.

Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia is the country's leading community-based organisation for prostate cancer research, awareness, and support. We exist to protect the health of existing and future generations of men in Australia and to improve quality of life for men and families impacted by prostate cancer. Our vision is a future where no man dies of prostate cancer and Australian men and their families get the support they need. September marks Prostate Cancer Awareness Month and The Long Run campaign. The campaign challenges people to run 72km throughout the month of September to raise vital funds and awareness for PCFA's prostate cancer research and support services. Prostate cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia, with 1 in 5 men diagnosed before the age of 85. That's over 24,000 each year. Raising awareness of prostate cancer and inspiring locals to fundraise will help save lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia Limited

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

Our vision is a future where no man dies of prostate cancer and Australian men and their families get the support they need. September marks Prostate Cancer Awareness Month and The Long Run campaign. The campaign challenges people to run 72km throughout the month of September to raise vital funds and awareness for PCFA's prostate cancer research and support services. Prostate cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia, with 1 in 5 men diagnosed before the age of 85. That's over 24,000 each year. This Light Up is organised by: Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia Limited

item.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, September 28, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support Prostate Cancer Awareness Month.

Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia is the country's leading community-based organisation for prostate cancer research, awareness, and support. We exist to protect the health of existing and future generations of men in Australia and to improve quality of life for men and families impacted by prostate cancer. Our vision is a future where no man dies of prostate cancer and Australian men and their families get the support they need. September marks Prostate Cancer Awareness Month and The Long Run campaign. The campaign challenges people to run 72km throughout the month of September to raise vital funds and awareness for PCFA's prostate cancer research and support services. Prostate cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia, with 1 in 5 men diagnosed before the age of 85. That's over 24,000 each year. Raising awareness of prostate cancer and inspiring locals to fundraise will help save lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia Limited

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day
item.description:
Friday, September 29, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and White to commemorate National Police Remembrance Day.

National Police Remembrance Day (NPRD) recognises annually the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers who have died whilst on duty. It falls on the 29th of September each year. Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honor those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honor those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

item.title: Eve of Big Gay Day
item.description:
Saturday, September 30, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to celebrate Eve of Big Gay Day.

Big Gay Day raises funds for 2 local LGBTQIA+ charities. The event celebrates Brisbane's queer performance scene and creates a safe welcoming space for the rainbow community to celebrate.

This Light Up is organised by: Wickham Hotel

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to celebrate Eve of Big Gay Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Wickham Hotel
